pullRequest.body:
`Ordering.orElse` is a duplicate of `Ordering.then` from Init. Similarly, `toRel` is a duplicate of `Compares`. (`cmp` is also a duplicate of `compareOfLessAndEq`, but it's used quite heavily and the new name is a bit...)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

@digama0 Can you merge master, please - so this PR can get reviewed? Thanks!

:v: digama0 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10855485323/job/30128193586)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10855485323/job/30128193379)

Do we actually want to be moving things *into* `Init`? My impression was that `Init` was basically just "cruft from core that we haven't decided what to do with yet", for which the natural progression is to gradually either promote or delete declarations.

I did this only from a avoiding-unnecessary-imports perspective. `Compares` was in a file with lots of imports and there are other `Init` files that import this and use `toRel`, now `Compares`.

I agree we should evacuate the file eventually, but this will most likely involve creating *new* files to avoid spurious import dependencies, and it's unrelated to the purpose of this PR. I think we should do it separately.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: deprecate `Ordering.orElse` for `.then`
